head.title: World Briefing | Americas: Inuit Climate Change Petition Rejected

hedline.hl1: World Briefing | Americas: Inuit Climate Change Petition Rejected

abstract.p: Inter-American Commission on Human Rights declines to rule on complaint by native Arctic peoples that global warming caused by gases from US violates their right to sustain their traditional way; Inuit leaders say they will seek hearing to present more evidence (S)

block.p: The Inter-American Commission on Human Rights, an arm of the Organization of American States, has declined to rule on a complaint by native Arctic peoples that global warming caused by gases from the United States violates their right to sustain their traditional ways. The agency told the Inuit Circumpolar Conference, which represents 150,000 people in northern Alaska, Canada, Russia and Greenland, that there was insufficient evidence of harm. Inuit leaders said they would seek a hearing to present more evidence.
